inclusion.criterion: child will be randomised to treatment with either AL or DP.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: supervised at the health centre in the morning and the evening on day 0, day 1, and day 2.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: At each visit and in the morning on day 3, the child will be examined, the mother asked for any symptoms and signs of side-effects, the temperature measured.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: a blood sample will be taken for examination of malaria parasites.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: On day 0 samples for measurement of antimalarial drugs and for genotyping of the parasites will be taken on filterpaper.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: In a subgroup of 50 children a blood sample for in vitro culturing and for analysis of the number of leucocytes will also be taken.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: After having finished the treatment the children will be followed on day 7 and then once a week until day 42.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: At each visit the condition of the child will be examined and a bloodsample taken for examination of parasites in the blood.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Furthermore, a filterpaper bloodsample will be collected for measurement of the drug concentration of if the child has recrudescence for genotyping of the parasites.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: On day 0, 3 and 42 the haemoglobin level will be examined.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The result of the two treatments will be evaluated by comparing the number of children with recurrent parasitaemia, both corrected and uncorrected (recrudescence vs. reinfections).
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: This will be presented as adequate clinical and parasitological response rates PCR-corrected and PCR-uncorrected.
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: symptoms Prostration. Impaired consciousness. Respiratory distress. Repeated generalised convulsions (three or more per 24 hours or 2 witnessed seizures in 24 hours).
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: The patient is a 25-year-old pregnant woman with fever, chills, nausea, vomiting, dysuria, urgency and frequency. She has no history of recurrent UTI prior to her pregnancy or any other underlying disease.
